monoxide has no color and odor, which makes it very difficult to detect. The symptoms of intoxication depend on the concentration of carbon monoxide and the duration of exposure and are manifested by nausea, dizziness and headache. Therefore, we must remove the victims to fresh air, ventilate the rooms and contact the emergency medical service.\\r
